skills.name: Recognise if two ratios are equivalent
Divide a quantity into two parts for a given ratio, where each part is an integer
Given information about one part, work out other parts
Given information about the relationship between two parts (e.g. one part is worth 5 more than another), work out other parts

explanations.A: Nearly! This is how we write the ratio, but we need to simplify it. Can you divide 12 and 30 by the same number? Keep doing this until you don't have a common factor anymore.
explanations.B: Nearly! This is how we write the ratio, but we need to fully simplify it. Can you think of a number that divides into both 6 an 15? Try using this number to simplify this further.
explanations.C: 12 and 30 share a common factor of 6. 12 ÷ 6 = 2 and 30 ÷ 6 = 5. Therefore, 12:30 can be fully simplified to 2:5.

explanations.A: For every 6 sweets Kate has Isaac has 15. Multiplying both of these values by the same number will give an equivalent ratio. We have multiplied by 3 here, so 18:45 would be an equivalent ratio.
explanations.B: For every 6 sweets Kate has, Isaac has 15. This means for every 2 sweets Kate has, Isaac has 5. If Kate has 7 groups of 2 sweets, and Isaac has 7 groups of 5 sweets, they would have 14:35 so this would be equivalent.
explanations.C: The ratio 9 : 18 when expressed in its simplest form is 1 : 2, whereas 6 : 15 in its simplest form is 2 : 5. Therefore these two ratios are not equivalent.
explanations.D: For every 6 sweets Kate has, Isaac has 15. By dividing by a common factor, this can be simplified. We can divide by 3 here, so 2:5 would be an equivalent ratio.

explanations.A: For every 6p Josh gets Lucy gets 18p. Multiplying both of these by 3 tells us that if Josh gets 18p then Lucy will get 54p, not 56. Therefore, these two ratios are not equivalent.
explanations.B: For every 6p Josh has, Lucy has 18p. 6 and 18 have a highest common factor of 6, so both numbers can be divided by 6 and remain an equivalent ratio. Therefore, 1:3 is an equivalent ratio of 6:18.
explanations.C: For every 6p Josh has, Lucy has 18p. The numbers can both be divided by 6 and remain equivalent, leaving a ratio of 1:3. Both 1 and 3 can be multiplied by 9, meaning 9:27 is equivalent to 6:18. Alternatively, 6 x 1.5 = 9 and 18 x 1.5 = 27.
explanations.D: For every 6p Josh has, Lucy has 18p. Both 6 and 18 can be divided by 3, creating an equivalent ratio of 2:6. Both 2 and 6 can be multiplied by 2, showing how 4:12 is an equivalent ratio.
